sigmahq/proc_creation_win_mssql_veaam_su.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the Veeam service process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_mstsc_rdp_hija.description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_mstsc_run_loca.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.
Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_msxsl_remote_e.description: Detects the execution of the "msxsl" binary with an "http" keyword in the command line. This might indicate a potential remote execution of XSL files.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_net_use_mount_.description: Detects when an internet hosted webdav share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_net_user_add_n.description: Detects creation of local users via the net.exe command with the option "never expire"

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_net_user_defau.description: Detects suspicious manipulations of default accounts such as 'administrator' and 'guest'. For example 'enable' or 'disable' accounts or change the password...etc

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_fw_allow.description: Detects Netsh command execution that whitelists a program located in a suspicious location in the Windows Firewall
Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_netsh_port_for.description: Detects the execution of netsh to configure a port forwarding of port 3389 (RDP) rule

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_node_abuse.description: Detects the execution node.exe which is shipped with multiple software such as VMware, Adobe...etc. In order to execute arbitrary code. For example to establish reverse shell as seen in Log4j attacks...etc

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_nslookup_domai.description: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_drive.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "INSTALLDRIVER" action where the driver doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. This is often used as a defense evasion method.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_exec_.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" where the path of the DLL being registered is located in a potentially suspicious location.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_odbcconf_regis.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "REGSVR" action where the DLL in question doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. Which is often used as a method to evade defenses.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_arbitra.description: Detects potential arbitrary file download using a Microsoft Office application

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_excel_d.description: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_exec_fr.description: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_onenote.description: Detects the execution of malicious OneNote documents that contain embedded scripts. When a user clicks on a OneNote attachment and then on the malicious link inside the ".one" file, it exports and executes the malicious embedded script from specific directories.
Detects suspicious child processes of the Microsoft OneNote application. This may indicate an attempt to execute malicious embedded objects from a .one file.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_outlook.description: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros
Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder
Detects a suspicious process spawning from an Outlook process.
Detects a suspicious child process spawning from Outlook where the image is located in a remote location (SMB/WebDav shares).

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_spawn_e.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_office_susp_ch.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ping_hex_ip.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_port_for.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel port forwarding to a local port

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_plink_susp_tun.description: Execution of plink to perform data exfiltration and tunneling

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_aad.description: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ams.description: Detects Request to "amsiInitFailed" that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_bas.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains
Detects suspicious UTF16 and base64 encoded and often obfuscated PowerShell code often used in command lines
Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line
Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines
Detects usage of a base64 encoded "IEX" cmdlet in a process command line
Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls
Detects base64 encoded "MpPreference" PowerShell cmdlet code that tries to modifies or tamper with Windows Defender AV
Detects base64 encoded .NET reflective loading of Assembly
Detects suspicious base64 encoded and obfuscated "LOAD" keyword used in .NET "reflection.assembly"
Detects calls to base64 encoded WMI class such as "Win32_ShadowCopy", "Win32_ScheduledJob", etc.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_cmd.description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dec.description: Detects PowerShell commands that decrypt an ".LNK" "file to drop the next stage of the malware.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_def.description: Detects requests to disable Microsoft Defender features using PowerShell commands

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dis.description: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell
Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_dow.description: Detects the execution of a specific OneLiner to download and execute powershell modules in memory.
Detects PowerShell download and execution cradles.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ema.description: Detects email exfiltration via powershell cmdlets

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_fro.description: Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_get.description: Detects a "Get-Process" cmdlet and it's aliases on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_hid.description: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_iex.description: Detects suspicious ways to run Invoke-Execution using IEX alias

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_imp.description: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_mai.description: Detects usage of the powerShell New-MailboxExportRequest Cmdlet to exports a mailbox to a remote or local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_obf.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_pub.description: This rule detects execution of PowerShell scripts located in the "C:\Users\Public" folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rem.description: Detects calls to the AtomicTestHarnesses "Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand" which is designed to abuse the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary to run custom PowerShell code via module load-order hijacking.
Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender configurations using the 'MpPreference' cmdlet

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_rev.description: Detects usage of the "TcpClient" class. Which can be abused to establish remote connections and reverse-shells. As seen used by the Nishang "Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine" reverse shell and other.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_run.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)
Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sam.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_ser.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications via the "Set-Service" cmdlet using the "SecurityDescriptorSddl" flag (Only available with PowerShell 7) that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_set.description: Detects PowerShell execution to set the ACL of a file or a folder
Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sha.description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sna.description: Detects adding and using Exchange PowerShell snap-ins to export mailbox data. As seen used by HAFNIUM and APT27

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_sus.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)
Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
Detects a suspicious or uncommon parent processes of PowerShell
Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_tok.description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_powershell_web.description: Detects PowerShell command line contents that include a suspicious abnormal casing in the Net.Webclient (e.g. nEt.WEbCliEnT) string as used in obfuscation techniques

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_provlaunch_sus.description: Detects suspicious child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_3proxy_exe.description: Detects the use of 3proxy, a tiny free proxy server

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_enu.description: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_adfind_sus.description: Detects AdFind execution with common flags seen used during attacks

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_advancedru.description: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility in the context of the TrustedInstaller, SYSTEM, Local Service or Network Service accounts

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_chisel.description: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_cleanwipe.description: Detects the use of CleanWipe a tool usually used to delete Symantec antivirus.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_crassus.description: Detects Crassus, a Windows privilege escalation discovery tool, based on PE metadata characteristics.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_csexec.description: Detects the use of the lesser known remote execution tool named CsExec a PsExec alternative

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_defenderch.description: Detects the use of DefenderCheck, a tool to evaluate the signatures used in Microsoft Defender. It can be used to figure out the strings / byte chains used in Microsoft Defender to detect a tool and thus used for AV evasion.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ditsnap.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool, an inspection tool for Active Directory database, ntds.dit.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_frp.description: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_iox.description: Detects the use of IOX - a tool for port forwarding and intranet proxy purposes

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_netcat.description: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_ngrok.description: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available. Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nimgrab.description: Detects the usage of nimgrab, a tool bundled with the Nim programming framework and used for downloading files.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nircmd_as_.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nps.description: Detects the use of NPS, a port forwarding and intranet penetration proxy server

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_nsudo.description: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_rclone_exe.description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_runxcmd.description: Detects the use of the RunXCmd tool to execute commands with System or TrustedInstaller accounts

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_seatbelt.description: Detects the execution of the PUA/Recon tool Seatbelt via PE information of command line parameters

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_pua_wsudo_susp.description: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_python_pty_spa.description: Detects python spawning a pretty tty

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_compressio.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rar_susp_greed.description: Detects RAR usage that creates an archive from a suspicious folder, either a system folder or one of the folders often used by attackers for staging purposes

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rdrleakdiag_pr.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_add_safebo.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "add" or "copy" flags on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to allow the ransomware to work in safe mode as some security products do not

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_bitlocker.description: Detects suspicious addition to BitLocker related registry keys via the reg.exe utility

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_saf.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to prevent safeboot execution of security products

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_delete_ser.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_disable_se.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_dumping_se.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to dump sensitive registry hives. This includes SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY hives.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_disabl.description: Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode. RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop. This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_lsa_ppl_pr.description: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_nolmhash.description: Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes. By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_rdp_keys_t.description: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_susp_paths.description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_volsnap_di.description: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_reg_windows_de.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_export.description: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_import.description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regedit_truste.description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regini_ads.description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_ie_se.description: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_insta.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_logon.description: Detects the addition of a new LogonScript to the registry value "UserInitMprLogonScript" for potential persistence

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_new_n.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_offic.description: Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed. Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_privi.description: Detect modification of services configuration (ImagePath, FailureCommand and ServiceDLL) in registry by processes with Medium integrity level

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_provl.description: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_registry_set_u.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_http_.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download and install DLLs located remotely where the address is an IP address.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_remot.description: Detects REGSVR32.exe to execute DLL hosted on remote shares

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_regsvr32_susp_.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "regsvr32.exe".
Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a highly suspicious locations
Detects the execution of REGSVR32.exe with DLL files masquerading as other files

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_remote_access_.description: Detects AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation. Which can be used by attackers to gain remote access.

An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks. These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment. Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_adfind.description: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_autoit.description: Detects the execution of a renamed AutoIt2.exe or AutoIt3.exe. AutoIt is a scripting language and automation tool for Windows systems. While primarily used for legitimate automation tasks, it can be misused in cyber attacks. Attackers can leverage AutoIt to create and distribute malware, including keyloggers, spyware, and botnets. A renamed AutoIt executable is particularly suspicious.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_binary.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_browse.description: Detects process creation with a renamed BrowserCore.exe (used to extract Azure tokens)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_cloudf.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "cloudflared" binary.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_create.description: Detects uses of a renamed legitimate createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_dctask.description: Detects a renamed "dctask64.exe" execution, a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central. This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_gpg4wi.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "gpg.exe". Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_jusche.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "jusched.exe" as seen used by the cobalt group

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_mavinj.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the "Mavinject" process. Which can be abused to perform process injection using the "/INJECTRUNNING" flag

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_megasy.description: Detects the execution of a renamed MegaSync.exe as seen used by ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_msdt.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "Msdt.exe" binary

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_netsup.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "client32.exe" (NetSupport RAT) via Imphash, Product and OriginalFileName strings

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_office.description: Detects the execution of a renamed office binary

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_paexec.description: Detects execution of renamed version of PAExec. Often used by attackers

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_plink.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the Plink binary

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_rundll.description: Detects when 'DllRegisterServer' is called in the commandline and the image is not rundll32. This could mean that the 'rundll32' utility has been renamed in order to avoid detection

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_sysint.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution
Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable. This often done by attackers or malware in order to evade defensive mechanisms.
Detects suspicious launch of a renamed version of the PSEXESVC service with, which is not often used by legitimate administrators
Detects the use of a renamed SysInternals Sdelete, which is something an administrator shouldn't do (the renaming)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_vmnat.description: Detects renamed vmnat.exe or portable version that can be used for DLL side-loading

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_renamed_whoami.description: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ads_s.description: Detects execution of rundll32 where the DLL being called is stored in an Alternate Data Stream (ADS).

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_advpa.description: Detects execution of "rundll32" calling "advpack.dll" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls in order to leverage the "RegisterOCX" function

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_inlin.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_keymg.description: Detects the invocation of the Stored User Names and Passwords dialogue (Key Manager)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_mshtm.description: Detects execution of commands that leverage the "mshtml.dll" RunHTMLApplication export to run arbitrary code via different protocol handlers (vbscript, javascript, file, http...)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_no_pa.description: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_ntlmr.description: Detects a privilege elevation attempt by coercing NTLM authentication on the Printer Spooler service

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_proce.description: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_shell.description: Detects shell32.dll executing a DLL in a suspicious directory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_spawn.description: Detects RunDLL32.exe spawning explorer.exe as child, which is very uncommon, often observes Gamarue spawning the explorer.exe process in an unusual way

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_susp_.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits
Detects the execution of Rundll32.exe with DLL files masquerading as image files
Detects suspicious usage of the ShellExec_RunDLL function to launch other commands as seen in the the raspberry-robin attack
Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_sys.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_unc_p.description: Detects rundll32 execution where the DLL is located on a remote location (share)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_webda.description: Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server) or potentially a sign of exploitation of CVE-2023-23397

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_rundll32_witho.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_change_sevi.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_allow.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_deny_.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to deny access to a service that affects critical trustees. This can be used to hide services or make them unstoppable.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_sdset_hide_.description: Detects usage of the "sc.exe" utility adding a new service with special permission seen used by threat actors which makes the service hidden and unremovable.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sc_service_pat.description: Detects service path modification via the "sc" binary to a suspicious command or path

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_appda.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that executes a file from C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_chang.description: Detects when an attacker tries to modify an already existing scheduled tasks to run from a suspicious location Attackers can create a simple looking task in order to avoid detection on creation as it's often the most focused on Instead they modify the task after creation to include their malicious payload

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_creat.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_delet.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities
Detects the usage of schtasks with the delete flag and the asterisk symbol to delete all tasks from the schedule of the local computer, including tasks scheduled by other users.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_disab.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_folde.description: Detects scheduled task creations that have suspicious action command and folder combinations

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_one_t.description: Detects scheduled task creation events that include suspicious actions, and is run once at 00:00

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_power.description: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_reg_l.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that potentially executes a base64 encoded payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_sched.description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_schtasks_syste.description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_scrcons_susp_c.description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sdiagnhost_sus.description: Detects sdiagnhost.exe calling a suspicious child process (e.g. used in exploits for Follina / CVE-2022-30190)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_servu_susp_chi.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_setres_uncommo.description: Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE. Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution. It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_splwow64_cli_a.description: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_spoolsv_susp_c.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlcmd_veeam_d.description: Detects dump of credentials in VeeamBackup dbo

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_chromiu.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Chromium-based browsers for potential data stealing.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sqlite_firefox.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers for potential data stealing.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ssh_rdp_tunnel.description: Execution of ssh.exe to perform data exfiltration and tunneling through RDP

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_stordiag_susp_.description: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_abusing_d.description: Detection of unusual child processes by different system processes

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_add_user_.description: Detects addition of users to highly privileged groups via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".
Detects addition of users to the local Remote Desktop Users group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_archiver_.description: Detects cases in which an ISO files is opend within an archiver like 7Zip or Winrar, which is a sign of phishing as threat actors put small ISO files in archives as email attachments to bypass certain filters and protective measures (mark of web)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_child_pro.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE accounts

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_cli_obfus.description: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using unicode characters. Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_copy_syst.description: Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a known LOLBIN from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk in order to bypass detections based on locations.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_crypto_mi.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_data_exfi.description: Detects the use of various CLI utilities exfiltrating data via web requests

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_disable_r.description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_double_ex.description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns
Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_download_.description: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_dumpstack.description: Detects the use of the filename DumpStack.log to evade Microsoft Defender

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_emoji_usa.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.
Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_modif.description: Detects changes to environment variables related to ETW logging via the CommandLine. This could indicate potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_etw_trace.description: Detects command line activity that tries to clear or disable any ETW trace log which could be a sign of logging evasion.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_eventlog_.description: Detects the clearing or configuration tampering of EventLog using utilities such as "wevtutil", "powershell" and "wmic". This technique were seen used by threat actors and ransomware strains in order to evade defenses.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_execution.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a parent process located in the "\Users\Public" folder executing a child process containing references to shell or scripting binaries and commandlines.
Detects a potentially suspicious execution from an uncommon folder.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_gather_ne.description: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_image_mis.description: Checks whether the image specified in a process creation event is not a full, absolute path (caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_ba.description: Detects encoded base64 MZ header in the commandline

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_inline_wi.description: Detects the use of WinAPI Functions via the commandline. As seen used by threat actors via the tool winapiexec

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_lsass_dmp.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "lsass" and ".dmp" in the commandline, which could indicate a potential attempt to dump or create a dump of the lsass process.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_non_priv_.description: Search for usage of reg or Powershell by non-privileged users to modify service configuration in registry

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_ntds.description: Detects suspicious process patterns used in NTDS.DIT exfiltration

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_nteventlo.description: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_parents.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_powershel.description: Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll. This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_priv_esca.description: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_progname.description: Detects suspicious patterns in program names or folders that are often found in malicious samples or hacktools

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_recycle_b.description: Detects process execution from a fake recycle bin folder, often used to avoid security solution.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_redirect_.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_right_to_.description: Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence. This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_script_ex.description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_sensitive.description: Detects a command that accesses the VolumeShadowCopy in order to extract sensitive files such as the Security or SAM registry hives or the AD database (ntds.dit)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_c.description: Detects creation of a new service via "sc" command or the powershell "new-service" cmdlet with suspicious binary paths

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_d.description: Detects a service binary running in a suspicious directory

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_service_t.description: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shadow_co.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_shell_spa.description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_system_us.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_task_fold.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_whoami_as.description: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_susp_workfolde.description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_execut.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_svchost_termse.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_a.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database to a suspicious directory.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_p.description: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name

Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we are also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.
Detects suspicious commandline flags used by PsExec and PAExec to escalate a command line to LOCAL_SYSTEM rights
Detects potential psexec command that initiate execution on a remote systems via common commandline flags used by the utility

Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)
Detects suspicious execution of Sysinternals PsSuspend, where the utility is used to suspend critical processes such as AV or EDR to bypass defenses

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_sysinternals_s.description: Detects the use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space
Detects unknown program using commandline flags usually used by tools such as PsExec and PAExec to start programs with SYSTEM Privileges
Detects the removal of Sysmon, which could be a potential attempt at defense evasion

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_systemsettings.description: Detects when a user enable developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskkill_sep.description: Detects one of the possible scenarios for disabling Symantec Endpoint Protection. Symantec Endpoint Protection antivirus software services incorrectly implement the protected service mechanism. As a result, the NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM user can execute the taskkill /im command several times ccSvcHst.exe /f, thereby killing the process belonging to the service, and thus shutting down the service.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_taskmgr_locals.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_localsys.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_tscon_rdp_redi.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cha.description: Detects an UAC bypass that uses changepk.exe and slui.exe (UACMe 61)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cle.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using scheduled tasks and variable expansion of cleanmgr.exe (UACMe 34)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_cms.description: Detect commandline usage of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe) to install specially formatted local .INF files
Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_com.description: Detects tools such as UACMe used to bypass UAC with computerdefaults.exe (UACMe 59)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_con.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_dis.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using DismHost DLL hijacking (UACMe 63)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_eve.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Event Viewer RecentViews

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_fod.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_icm.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using ICMLuaUtil Elevated COM interface

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_iei.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_msc.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_ntf.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_pkg.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using pkgmgr.exe and dism.exe (UACMe 23)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_tru.description: Detects indicators of a UAC bypass method by mocking directories

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_win.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wmp.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uac_bypass_wsr.description: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass via WSReset usable by default sysmon-config

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_ultravnc_susp_.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_uninstall_crow.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_userinit_uncom.description: Detects uncommon "userinit.exe" child processes, which could be a sign of uncommon shells or login scripts used for persistence.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_toolbox.description: Detects execution of the "VMwareToolBoxCmd.exe" with the "script" and "set" flag to setup a specific script that's located in a potentially suspicious location to run for a specific VM state

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vmware_vmtools.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_vscode_tunnel_.description: Detects renamed Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_w32tm.description: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_execution_.description: Detects execution of wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) from non default locations as seen with bumblebee activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wab_unusual_pa.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) processes as seen being used with bumblebee activity

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wbadmin_delete.description: Detects the deletion of all backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe". This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors. This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_chopp.description: Detects patterns found in process executions cause by China Chopper like tiny (ASPX) webshells

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_hacki.description: Detects certain parent child patterns found in cases in which a web shell is used to perform certain credential dumping or exfiltration activities on a compromised system

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_recon.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_susp_.description: Detects potentially suspicious processes being spawned by a web server process which could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or exploitation

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_webshell_tool_.description: Detects processes spawned from web servers (PHP, Tomcat, IIS, etc.) that perform reconnaissance looking for the existence of popular scripting tools (perl, python, wget) on the system via the help commands

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_werfault_lsass.description: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wermgr_susp_ex.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) execution location.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wget_download_.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using Wget.exe

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_executi.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" by privileged accounts that are often abused by threat actors

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_whoami_priv_di.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winget_add_ins.description: Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source. Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_winrm_susp_chi.description: Detects suspicious processes including shells spawnd from WinRM host process

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmi_backdoor_e.description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_eventcons.description: Detects WMIC executions in which an event consumer gets created. This could be used to establish persistence

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_namespace.description: Detects potential tampering with Windows Defender settings such as adding exclusion using wmic

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_exec.description: Office application called wmic to proxye execution through a LOLBIN process. This is often used to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_susp_proc.description: Detects WMIC executing "process call create" with suspicious calls to processes such as "rundll32", "regsrv32", etc.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmic_uninstall.description: Detects uninstallation or termination of security products using the WMIC utility

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wmiprvse_susp_.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wpbbin_potenti.description: Detects execution of the binary "wpbbin" which is used as part of the UEFI based persistence method described in the reference section

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wscript_cscrip.description: Detects Wscript/Cscript executing a file with an uncommon (i.e. non-script) extension

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_dll_lo.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) for proxy execution.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wuauclt_no_cli.description: Detects suspicious Windows Update Agent activity in which a wuauclt.exe process command line doesn't contain any command line flags

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_wusa_cab_files.description: Detects the execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract ".cab" files using the "/extract" argument from potentially suspicious paths.

sigmahq/proc_creation_win_xwizard_execut.description: Detects the execution of Xwizard tool from a non-default directory. When executed from a non-default directory, this utility can be abused in order to side load a custom version of "xwizards.dll".
